intro: Dimeria leptorhachis subsp. velutina, commonly known as the velvet dimeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
